info.title: HubSpot Marketing V2
info.description: Marketing software that enables you to drive revenue, save time and resources, and measure and optimize your investments. All on one easy-to-use platform. Drive revenue by connecting with leads at the right time and place across email, landing pages, forms, and more. Manage your contacts and campaigns in one place and use automation tools to scale your efficiency. Measure the success of your campaigns using powerful reporting tools.

get.description: Queries a single token by identifier.

delete.description: Deletes a single token by identifier.

get.description: Queries multiple SMTP tokens by campaign name or a single token by email campaign identifier.

post.description: Allows the creation of a replacement password for a given token. Once the password is successfully reset, the old password for the token will be invalid.
Asynchronously send a transactional email. Returns the status of the email send with a status identifier that can be used to continuously query for the status using the Email Send Status.
Subscribes a contact to the given subscription type. This action is not valid to use for subscribing a contact at a brand or portal level and will return an error.
Unsubscribes a contact from the given subscription type. This action is not valid to use for unsubscribing a contact at a brand or portal level and will return an error.

get.description: Returns a list of subscriptions and their status for a given contact.

post.description: Creates a bulk communication preferences request. This request will return a status identifier that can be used to continuously query for the status using the Bulk Communication Preferences Status.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all subscription definitions for the portal.
Retrieves aggregated statistics of emails sent in a specified time span. It also returns the list of emails that were sent during the time span.
Retrieves aggregated statistics in intervals for a specified time span. Each interval contains aggregated statistics of the emails that were sent in that time.
Retrieves the variation of an A/B marketing email. If the email is variation A (master) it will return variation B (variant) and vice versa.

useHeadlineAsSubject.description: Whether to use headline as subject.
useHeadlineAsSubject.title: Use Headline As Subject

post.description: Resets the draft back to a copy of the live object.
Restores a previous revision of a marketing email to DRAFT state. If there is currently something in the draft for that object, it is overwritten.

useHeadlineAsSubject.description: Whether to use headline as subject.
useHeadlineAsSubject.title: Use Headline As Subject

get.description: Retrieves the draft version of an email (if it exists). If no draft version exists, the published email is returned.

useHeadlineAsSubject.description: Whether to use headline as subject.
useHeadlineAsSubject.title: Use Headline As Subject

patch.description: Creates or updates the draft version of a marketing email. If no draft exists, the system creates a draft from the current “live” email then applies the request body to that draft. The draft version only lives on the buffer—the email is not cloned.

useHeadlineAsSubject.description: Whether to use headline as subject.
useHeadlineAsSubject.title: Use Headline As Subject

useHeadlineAsSubject.description: Whether to use headline as subject.
useHeadlineAsSubject.title: Use Headline As Subject

get.description: Retrieves a list of all versions of a marketing email, with each entry including the full state of that particular version. The current revision has the ID -1.

post.description: Creates a variation of a marketing email for an A/B test. The new variation will be created as a draft. If an active variation already exists, a new one won't be created.
